üì© Email a√±adido a tarjeta:
De: CustomGPT.ai <hello@customgpt.ai>
Asunto: Introducing CustomGPT.ai Verified Responses - Trust Built Into Every Answer
Fecha: Thu, 22 Jan 2026 15:09:22 +0000

Image ( https://customgpt.ai/ )
Hey Lagrafica,

¬†

Every answer now comes with receipts - providing full visibility into how your AI thinks.

¬†

With Verify Responses ( https://customgpt.ai/platform/verify-responses/ ), your CustomGPT.ai agent doesn't just give answers - it shows exactly how it got there. Every claim traced. Every source visible. Full transparency, on demand.

Introducing CustomGPT.ai Verified Responses - Trust Built Into Every Answer ( https://customgpt.ai/platform/verify-responses/ )
Enable Verify Responses Now ( https://app.customgpt.ai/login )Why building trust in AI matters

¬†

Your team sees the potential of AI. But your CISO, compliance officer, and legal team see risk.

"Where did that answer come from?" "Can we audit this?" "How do we know it's not hallucinating?"

These questions keep powerful AI tools stuck in pilot mode forever.

¬†

Verify Responses answers all of them - automatically.

How we use it at CustomGPT.ai

¬†

We became our own first users. Again.

We enabled Verify Responses on our own support agents and tracked every response. What we found surprised us.

The AI wasn't always the problem. Our documentation was.

We discovered gaps we never knew existed - questions users were asking that our knowledge base didn't fully cover. The AI was doing its best with incomplete information. And "doing its best" meant guessing.

"Every inaccurate response is a signal," says Marko Mitroviƒá, Product Manager at CustomGPT.ai. "It's telling you something. Either your AI needs tuning, your system needs fixing, or your content has gaps. You just have to listen."

The result? We fixed persona configurations, resolved system-level retrieval issues, and published two new documentation articles that directly addressed user needs.

Want the full breakdown? Read our complete case study here. ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-response-verification-case-study/ )

What you can do with this

*
Corporate compliance & audit trails ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-governance-checklist-enterprises/ ) - Give your CISO and compliance teams the documentation they need. Every claim is traceable. Every source is logged.
*
Security & QA reviews ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-governance-in-finance/ ) - Prove to stakeholders that your AI isn't making things up. Verify the quality of responses before deploying to production.
*
Find knowledge gaps ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-response-verification-case-study/ ) - Discover what's missing from your documentation. Low verified claims scores point directly to content you need to create.
*
Debug AI behavior ( https://docs.customgpt.ai/docs/verify-responses-best-practices ) - Stop guessing why your agent gave a weird answer. See exactly which sources it used and where it went wrong.
*
Clear approval bottlenecks ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-governance-raci-genai-assistants/ ) - Get Legal, Security, and Compliance to yes. Produce the evidence pack they actually need to approve.
What's inside

¬†

Claim Verifier - Automatically extracts every factual claim from a response and cross-references it against your source documents. You see exactly what's verified and what's not.

Verified Claims Score - Simple math: verified claims divided by total claims. If your AI makes 10 statements and 8 trace back to your docs, it scores 80%.

Trust Score - A virtual committee of six stakeholders - End User, Security / IT, Risk Compliance, Legal Compliance, Public Relations, Executive Leadership - analyzes every response for potential risks.

Customer Intelligence Integration - Filter conversations by verified responses score in your analytics dashboard. Identify problem responses instantly.

¬†

Learn more about how it works. ( https://docs.customgpt.ai/docs/understanding-your-verify-responses-results )

Two ways to use it

¬†

Builder mode - Enable Verify Responses via Actions and verification runs automatically on every chat. Perfect for development and QA.

¬†

Audit mode - Run verification manually on any conversation - even old ones. Results appear in seconds. Ideal for production audits and spot-checks.

¬†

cards.title: Introducing CustomGPT.ai Verified Responses - Trust Built Into Every Answer

descriptionBlocks.text:
De: CustomGPT.ai <hello@customgpt.ai>
Fecha: Thu, 22 Jan 2026 15:09:22 +0000

Image ( https://customgpt.ai/ )
Hey Lagrafica,

¬†

Every answer now comes with receipts - providing full visibility into how your AI thinks.

¬†

With Verify Responses ( https://customgpt.ai/platform/verify-responses/ ), your CustomGPT.ai agent doesn't just give answers - it shows exactly how it got there. Every claim traced. Every source visible. Full transparency, on demand.

Introducing CustomGPT.ai Verified Responses - Trust Built Into Every Answer ( https://customgpt.ai/platform/verify-responses/ )
Enable Verify Responses Now ( https://app.customgpt.ai/login )Why building trust in AI matters

¬†

Your team sees the potential of AI. But your CISO, compliance officer, and legal team see risk.

"Where did that answer come from?" "Can we audit this?" "How do we know it's not hallucinating?"

These questions keep powerful AI tools stuck in pilot mode forever.

¬†

Verify Responses answers all of them - automatically.

How we use it at CustomGPT.ai

¬†

We became our own first users. Again.

We enabled Verify Responses on our own support agents and tracked every response. What we found surprised us.

The AI wasn't always the problem. Our documentation was.

We discovered gaps we never knew existed - questions users were asking that our knowledge base didn't fully cover. The AI was doing its best with incomplete information. And "doing its best" meant guessing.

"Every inaccurate response is a signal," says Marko Mitroviƒá, Product Manager at CustomGPT.ai. "It's telling you something. Either your AI needs tuning, your system needs fixing, or your content has gaps. You just have to listen."

The result? We fixed persona configurations, resolved system-level retrieval issues, and published two new documentation articles that directly addressed user needs.

Want the full breakdown? Read our complete case study here. ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-response-verification-case-study/ )

What you can do with this

*
Corporate compliance & audit trails ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-governance-checklist-enterprises/ ) - Give your CISO and compliance teams the documentation they need. Every claim is traceable. Every source is logged.
*
Security & QA reviews ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-governance-in-finance/ ) - Prove to stakeholders that your AI isn't making things up. Verify the quality of responses before deploying to production.
*
Find knowledge gaps ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-response-verification-case-study/ ) - Discover what's missing from your documentation. Low verified claims scores point directly to content you need to create.
*
Debug AI behavior ( https://docs.customgpt.ai/docs/verify-responses-best-practices ) - Stop guessing why your agent gave a weird answer. See exactly which sources it used and where it went wrong.
*
Clear approval bottlenecks ( https://customgpt.ai/ai-governance-raci-genai-assistants/ ) - Get Legal, Security, and Compliance to yes. Produce the evidence pack they actually need to approve.
What's inside

¬†

Claim Verifier - Automatically extracts every factual claim from a response and cross-references it against your source documents. You see exactly what's verified and what's not.

Verified Claims Score - Simple math: verified claims divided by total claims. If your AI makes 10 statements and 8 trace back to your docs, it scores 80%.

Trust Score - A virtual committee of six stakeholders - End User, Security / IT, Risk Compliance, Legal Compliance, Public Relations, Executive Leadership - analyzes every response for potential risks.

Customer Intelligence Integration - Filter conversations by verified responses score in your analytics dashboard. Identify problem responses instantly.

¬†

Learn more about how it works. ( https://docs.customgpt.ai/docs/understanding-your-verify-responses-results )

Two ways to use it

¬†

Builder mode - Enable Verify Responses via Actions and verification runs automatically on every chat. Perfect for development and QA.

¬†

Audit mode - Run verification manually on any conversation - even old ones. Results appear in seconds. Ideal for production audits and spot-checks.

¬†

Pro tip: In production, keep it on if you need full auditability for your CISO or CIO. This also surfaces trust scores in your Customer Intelligence analytics.

¬†

See all use cases and workflows. ( https://docs.customgpt.ai/docs/verify-responses-use-cases )

Connect with us

¬†

Want to see how other businesses are using Verify Responses to build trust and improve their AI? Share your own results or get ideas from teams solving similar problems in our¬†CustomGPT.ai Slack Community ( https://customgpt.ai/slack )¬† today!

Cheers,

¬†

Alden Do Rosario

Founder & CEO @ CustomGPT.ai

¬†

Facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/customgpt/ )
Twitter ( https://twitter.com/customgpt )LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/customgpt/ )YouTube ( https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8FQFRCUgdoeeAVeXZmVdcw )
About ( https://customgpt.ai/ )¬† ¬† ¬†Blog ( https://customgpt.ai/blog/ )¬† ¬† ¬†Contact ( https://customgpt.ai/contact-us/ )

¬©2026 CustomGPT
169 Mohawk Path, Holliston, MA 01746

The email was sent to montse@lagrafica.com. To no longer receive these emails, unsubscribe ( https://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgTWkwgDAKWKWaSKWQGb5kDBjy3-ZZhxignvZNc= ) here.

En caso de que no accediera a su contenido antes de las 23:59:59 del d√≠a 02/02/26 en horario peninsular, se considerar√° que el acto de notificaci√≥n ha sido efectuado, aunque con resultado de rechazo, pudi√©ndose continuar el procedimiento administrativo correspondiente.

cards.title: RE: Continguts cartell JARDINS DE POL¬∑LINITZADORS 90X60 cms

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: Pietat Pizarro i Gonz√†lez <ppizarro@paeria.es>

Bon dia Neus!

Et dono retorn al cartell.

En general:

  *   Tots els noms en llat√≠ han d‚Äôanar en cursiva i els noms comuns en negreta, com a la resta de cartells (no estic segura de si ho estan o no).
  *   Respecte a l‚Äôaspecte general, al destacar la majoria de plantes amb flor √©s de molt batibull florit.... De fet coment√†vem que tot i que totes les plantes que posem tenen floracions vistoses, no totes floreixen alhora! De fet s‚Äôhan triat amb una floraci√≥ molt escalonada, hi hauran flors des de primavera a tardor... √©s a dir, que el jard√≠ no ser√† mai un esclat de floraci√≥ tan fort com la imatge de baset. Aix√≠, que com que ens interessa destacar la flor al detall de les esp√®cies, per facilitar el seu reconeixement, potser podr√≠em treure flor del dibuix de base... posant algunes mates verdes, en comptes de totes florides.  Pot ser? (i disculpa, perqu√® ser que fer aquest canvi ara √©s feina extra).
  *   Els comentaris puntuals te‚Äôls faig directament sobre la imatge, en el pdf.

cards.title: Proposta cartell a fer ITINERARI XARXA NATURA 2000

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: Pietat Pizarro i Gonz√†lez <ppizarro@paeria.es>

cards.title: LinkedIn relationships need a little TLC

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: 
	Stephanie Schwab at Crackerjack Marketing <hello@crackerjackmarketing.com>

Just a little goes a long way in staying connected.Hi Nuria,

Your LinkedIn network isn‚Äôt a houseplant‚Ä¶ but it does need a little water now and then if you want it to thrive.

It‚Äôs easy to think of networking as something you do once‚Äîconnect, check the box, move on.

Real relationships don‚Äôt work that way. And neither does LinkedIn. Your network is only as effective as how you nurture it.

The good news? Fostering relationships doesn‚Äôt have to be time-consuming or awkward. It‚Äôs usually the small, simple things that make the biggest difference.

Here are a few easy ways to keep key connections warm.

**1) Comment with Intention**

When someone in your network posts, take a moment to respond thoughtfully. Not just ‚ÄúGreat post!‚Äù but something that adds to the conversation or shows you‚Äôre paying attention.

**2) Send a Quick Check-In**

You don‚Äôt need a reason. A simple ‚ÄúSaw your update and thought of you‚Äù can go a long way toward keeping the relationship alive.

**3) S

Meet our Planning & Buying Award Judges of the Week

Some of the best and brightest creative media pros in the industry will be judging your submissions.

Steve Knapp is a proven leader, integrated activator and collaborative team builder with a pulse on evolving media; a thirst for innovation; and a strong belief in the integration of media, insights, analytics, creative, public relations and social media. cards.title: Out-of-Home Leaders Talk Creating Moments People Actually Care About

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: "Out-of-Home Insider Summit" <events@mediapost.com> 

Out-of-Home Pros Spend Three Days in Music CityMay 27-30, 2026

Nashville, TN      Register Now [https://events.mediapost.com/event/outofhome-nashville-2026/regProcessStep1]

OOH and experiential are emerging as the last uncluttered canvas for cultural impact and real-world connection. Digital signage, experiential activations, cross-brand collaborations and IRL event takeovers are becoming the connective tissue of modern marketing. How do we bring the rigor, attribution and full-funnel clarity to a medium defined by physicality, culture and spectacle?

This Spring, we‚Äôre expanding our Digital Out-of-Home Insider Summit to tackle the strategies, tools, and breakthroughs that will turn out-of-home from a legacy channel into marketing‚Äôs most dynamic canvas.

‚ÄúI am fortunate to have joined the MediaPost team at the OOH Insider Summit. It was fun and inspiring in equal amounts with great insights during the conference from both clients and agency fellows followed by great outings.

Hi there,

So here's a confession: my very first email address was something
like darknessfalls@theabyss.com.

I was 14. I wore a lot of black. I thought adding "the abyss" to
an email address made me deep and mysterious. It did not.

Fast forward a few years and I'm trying to apply for actual jobs
with an email address that screamed "I write angsty poetry in my
journal and nobody understands me."

I eventually gave up and created a new email, which meant
manually forwarding everything, updating every single account,
and losing half my contacts in the process. It was a nightmare.

Well, after TWO DECADES of people being stuck with their
questionable Gmail choices, Google finally caved.

You can now change your Gmail address without starting over.

That's right. If you created CoolDude2007@gmail.com as a teenager
(or let's be honest, last wee

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: "Data & Programmatic Insider Summit" <events@mediapost.com> 

An Unmatched Experience with Data & Programmatic LeadersAugust 16-19, 2026

Lake Tahoe, CA          Register Now [https://events.mediapost.com/event/dataprogrammatic-tahoe-2026/regProcessStep1]

While every programmatic media buyer let out a collective sigh of relief of ‚ÄúI told you so,‚Äù the need to diversify our ad strategies isn‚Äôt going anywhere. Some are pivoting back to contextual advertising; others are looking for alternative solutions to reach audiences and build their first-party data reservoirs. Even more are taking a hard look at their marketing technology and data strategy that powers this media machine.

At this summer‚Äôs Data and Programmatic Insider Summit, we‚Äôre peeling apart the pieces of programmatic advertising. We‚Äôll look at newer channels like CTV, gaming, YouTube and digital OOH. We‚Äôll debate the best way to unlock retail media insights. We‚Äôll wonder if AI will, in fact, take our jobs one day. We‚Äôll lament over media-mix modeling and measurement transparency. But at least we‚Äôll have a little fun doing it.

‚ÄúIn a world where the phrase ‚Äúwork conference‚Äù often elicits thoughts of hundreds of yawning suits in a massive room clinging to coffee for survival ‚Äì MediaPost sheds those negative dynamics and brings true value to the art of networking. cards.title: LinkedIn relationships need a little TLC

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: 
	Stephanie Schwab at Crackerjack Marketing <hello@crackerjackmarketing.com>

Just a little goes a long way in staying connected.Hi Nuria,

Your LinkedIn network isn‚Äôt a houseplant‚Ä¶ but it does need a little water now and then if you want it to thrive.

It‚Äôs easy to think of networking as something you do once‚Äîconnect, check the box, move on.

Real relationships don‚Äôt work that way. And neither does LinkedIn. Your network is only as effective as how you nurture it.

The good news? Fostering relationships doesn‚Äôt have to be time-consuming or awkward. It‚Äôs usually the small, simple things that make the biggest difference.

Here are a few easy ways to keep key connections warm.

**1) Comment with Intention**

When someone in your network posts, take a moment to respond thoughtfully. Not just ‚ÄúGreat post!‚Äù but something that adds to the conversation or shows you‚Äôre paying attention.

**2) Send a Quick Check-In**

You don‚Äôt need a reason. A simple ‚ÄúSaw your update and thought of you‚Äù can go a long way toward keeping the relationship alive.

**3) Share Something Useful**

An article, a podcast, an introduction‚Äîgenerosity builds trust faster than any sales pitch ever could.

**4) Celebrate Their Milestones**

New job? New product? Big win? A quick note of congratulations shows you care about more than just what they can do for you.

None of this is complicated. But it 

**is** powerful.

The truth is, when opportunities arise, people think of those who‚Äôve stayed present‚Ä¶ not those who only reach out when they need something.

Mara paused at the doorway of the conference room, balancing a notebook and a stainless steel bottle. ‚ÄúDid you already start without me?‚Äù she asked, seeing a few sketches scattered across the table.
Jon shook his head and pushed a chair out with his foot. ‚ÄúWe were just talking about how to explain the kit in simple language. No slogans, just clear details. Want to weigh in?‚Äù
‚ÄúI always want to weigh in,‚Äù Mara replied, settling in. ‚ÄúI think people appreciate hearing exactly what they receive, why it matters, and how it helps in daily life. We can keep the tone calm and respectful.‚Äù
Across the table, Priya flipped open her laptop. ‚ÄúI wrote a short note about the packing process,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt describes how the team checks each item, labels things clearly, and adds a short guide so nothing feels confusing.‚Äù
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs good,‚Äù Jon said. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs keep the language steady and supportive, like a neighbor explaining something helpful, not like someone trying to persuade at all costs.‚Äù
Mara nodded. ‚ÄúExactly. We can trust that people will understand the value when we speak plainly and focus on their experience.‚Äù

cards.title: Alejandro Magno no pensaba solo (y t√∫ s√≠)

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu autom√†tic de: Toni Cam√≠ <toni@tonicami.com>

Ma√±ana es lunes.

Y como muchos domingos, el cuerpo pide pausa‚Ä¶
pero la cabeza sigue funcionando.

Este fin de semana, entre otras cosas, he estado viendo una serie
de Netflix sobre Alejandro Magno.

No desde el punto de vista de un historiador.
Sino como un coach que pasa la semana sentado frente a l√≠deres
brillantes, responsables‚Ä¶
y completamente saturados.

La serie tiene licencias.
No es historia acad√©mica.
Pero hay algo que me sorprendi√≥.

No por lo que Alejandro hizo.
Sino por c√≥mo pensaba cuando nadie ten√≠a el control.

Y aqu√≠ viene la primera verdad inc√≥moda:

La mayor√≠a de l√≠deres cree que su problema es la falta de
informaci√≥n.
‚ÄãY no lo es.

El problema real es pensar solos en entornos que ya no admiten
pensamiento en solitario.

Alejandro no conquist√≥ medio mundo porque tuviera mejores datos.
No ten√≠a mapas fiables.
No ten√≠a precedentes.
No ten√≠a certezas.

Lo que ten√≠a era algo que escasea hoy en d√≠a:
üëâ un sistema para pensar estrat√©gicamente en medio de la
ambig√ºedad.

No esperaba claridad para decidir.
Dise√±aba claridad despu√©s de decidir.

Y, sobre todo, no pensaba solo.

Se rodeaba de estrategas y consejeros no para ejecutar‚Ä¶
sino para afilar el criterio y la estrategia antes de actuar.

Hoy ocurre justo lo contrario.

Veo como los l√≠deres ten√©is m√°s informaci√≥n que nunca.
M√°s herramientas.
M√°s dashboards.

Y aun as√≠:

* decid√≠s cansados
* decid√≠s tarde
* decid√≠s solos

No porque os falte capacidad.

of faith and protection.

Una auditor√≠a de marca profesional no consiste en dar una opini√≥n experta
sobre la marca actual. Consiste en un contraste t√©cnico entre dos
elementos:

 La Marca √ìptima: Es el resultado de la aplicaci√≥n de la estrategia de
marca que se construye junto al cliente. Define especificaciones precisas
sobre¬†c√≥mo deber√≠a ser la marca ideal para cumplir con los objetivos
buscados.
 La Marca Actual: Es la marca en uso, con sus virtudes y defectos.

El n√∫cleo de la auditor√≠a es evaluar, par√°metro por par√°metro de
rendimiento, el nivel de ajuste (o desajuste) entre la marca actual y la
√≥ptima. El resultado no es una opini√≥n, es un informe que revela brechas
de rendimiento medibles. Como dijo un directivo tras ver un diagn√≥stico
basado en este m√©todo: ‚ÄúNo esperaba esto, pero ahora entiendo todo...
con esta¬†metodolog√≠a, nos desarmaron‚Äù.

Este es el poder de un m√©todo. En el pr√≥ximo email, te presentar√© el
taller pr√°ctico donde podr√°s ejecutar tu propia auditor√≠a de principio a
fin.

Un saludo,

Luciano Cassisi
